data.text: @Claraphipps007 @AdrianFaiers @ReicherStephen @LoveWilko Screenshot page from the app & print out guidelines saying people are expected to stay at home. Ask for written acknowledgement of your letter & enc https://t.co/lpUhKUaua6

@AdrianFaiers @Ramblingproses @ReicherStephen @LoveWilko No reversal. A scripted explanation of them following "current Government guidelines" is all they have said, which of course is utter nonsense. At no time has the Government said "test postive and go to work".

@Claraphipps007 @Ramblingproses @ReicherStephen @LoveWilko @GMBLondonRegion Has anyone heard if #Wilko has yet reversed its 'report for work even if you test Covid positive' policy, or are they still showing contempt for staff and customers as well as potentially contributing to this?
https://t.co/SJOx03Jp5l
@Claraphipps007 @AmandaWjustme @helenvecht @ReicherStephen @LoveWilko @GMBLondonRegion You could report them to the HSE....maybe?
@Charlotteoleary @iandanforth @ReicherStephen @LoveWilko It IS ridiculous and astonishing. They say this... https://t.co/wMBGmA28ES

@Claraphipps007 @iandanforth @ReicherStephen @LoveWilko It's just ridiculous and interesting they've not replied to this. I have talked to some of my journalist friends about it to see what they make of it all!

@Charlotteoleary @iandanforth @ReicherStephen @LoveWilko Yep. I just don't know where else to go with this. Wilko are just brushing it off with a scripted response about "following Government guidance". Clearly they're not because THIS is Government guidance. 🙄 https://t.co/rZU9pyLiao
@Claraphipps007 @iandanforth @ReicherStephen @LoveWilko It occurred to me that it would also mean anyone positive would be traveling to work on buses and trains, and passing it around there too.
